intro: Lavatera mauritanica subsp. davaei, commonly known as the Mauritania lavatera, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It is characterized by its soft, woolly leaves and showy, pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to harsh conditions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in Mediterranean climates.
